Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is coarse and black in section, the interior is slightly grooved, pock-marked and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and very faint traces of at least eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393242) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393242)
